meanings.sent1: The puzzle was completive once the last piece was in place.
meanings.sent2: Her smile was completive, showing her satisfaction with the finished project.
meanings.sent3: The completive look on his face when he finished the race was priceless.
meanings.sent4: The completive sunset marked the end of a perfect day.
meanings.sent5: The completive feeling of relief washed over her as she submitted her final assignment.

meanings.sent1: The icing was completive on the cake, making it ready to serve.
meanings.sent2: His supportive words were completive in boosting her confidence.
meanings.sent3: The completive touch of adding sprinkles made the dessert even more appealing.
meanings.sent4: The completive handshake sealed the deal between the two business partners.
meanings.sent5: The completive music in the background set the perfect mood for the event.

meanings.definition: Marking the completion of an action or event.
meanings.sent1: The ringing of the bell was completive of the school day.
meanings.sent2: The celebratory cheers were completive of their successful performance.
meanings.sent3: The completive high-five between friends signaled the end of their game.
meanings.sent4: The completive fireworks lit up the sky after the concert.
meanings.sent5: The completive applause filled the room after the speaker's inspiring speech.
